channel.title: I need 317 server help, lag handler
channel.description: How can i make a lag handler? I am dealing with some lag and want to see if it will work.

item.title: I need 317 server help, lag handler
item.dc:creator: @DiNk DiNk
item.description:
@DiNk wrote:

Yes Wolfs goal, but what I said, it’s not ‘practically’ what you said.
Lowering the Client.java size is different to removing objects which barely lowers the Client.java size, maybe only by 0.00001 ehh… Milli Bytes

Read full topic

i said lower all file size’s no need for skomething to be like 600kb long about nothing relly, i seen good servers client.java be only 300kb

item.title: I need 317 server help, lag handler
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

[quote=“DiNk, post:5, topic:250288”]Laghandlers might help but for me it doesn’t.
Try remove object training if you have it, most people use it to mass train and causes lots of lag.

Try removing some un-useful objects, like added magic trees, you would only need one not a whole bunch(Only used for example)…

Try removing most useless stuff is what I suggest.[/quote]

thats practically what i said lol

Read full topic
item.source: I need 317 server help, lag handler

item.title: I need 317 server help, lag handler
item.dc:creator: @moparwha moparwha
item.description:
@moparwha wrote:

Just make things smaller like with voids and ints.

Instead of master you could have like

int b = skills[1][24]
addexp b, 1400000

item.title: I need 317 server help, lag handler
item.dc:creator: @DiNk DiNk
item.description:
@DiNk wrote:

Laghandlers might help but for me it doesn’t.
Try remove object training if you have it, most people use it to mass train and causes lots of lag.

Try removing some un-useful objects, like added magic trees, you would only need one not a whole bunch(Only used for example)…

Try removing most useless stuff is what I suggest.

Read full topic
